meanings.definition: A person or thing that swarms.
meanings.sent1: The swarmers gathered around the picnic table to enjoy the food.
meanings.sent2: The bees were busy swarmers, buzzing around the hive.
meanings.sent3: The swarmers at the party were like bees to honey, drawn to the music and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The crowd of fans outside the stadium resembled a sea of swarmers, eager to see their favorite team play.
meanings.sent5: The swarmers in the ant colony worked together tirelessly to build their intricate tunnels.

meanings.definition: A member of a group of insects or other small creatures that move in a large group.
meanings.sent1: The swarmers of ants marched in a straight line towards the food source.
meanings.sent2: The locusts were relentless swarmers, devouring everything in their path.
meanings.sent3: The swarmers of fireflies lit up the night sky like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: The school of fish moved as one, a shimmering mass of swarmers in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The swarmers of bees worked in harmony to protect their queen and hive.
